question.questionText: Angie wrote in her science notebook, "Evaporation only happens when water is heated to high temperatures." Explain why you agree or disagree.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Disagree. Evaporation can occur at any temperature.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: I disagree with you Angie. Yes that could happen but it is not always like that. Evaporation also could happen at any surface temperature.
I disagree because evaporation happens everywhere just slower in colder places.
No because water does not have to heated to a high temperature to evaporate, it would still evaporate if it was cold outside.
I agree because the only way water evaporates.
I do not agree. It does not matter if the water is heated or not because the sun will shine and it will still evaporate.
I disagree because it would only evaporate faster it can be in a room and evaporate but it would take longer.
I agree because I remember when the class put cups by the sun and it evaporated faster than all of the other cups we had around the room.
I agree because water does heated by the sun that evaporates so yes I agree.
I disagree because when we did our experiment the water in the jug evaporated, but not as fast.
I disagree because it does not only happen when water is heated.
I disagree because if it is hot out it will evaporate. But it still will evaporate if it is cool out. It just evaporates slower.
No, I do not agree, because water can evaporate when it is cold, it just goes slower.
I agree. Because cold water can it just takes longer.
I disagree Evaporation happens when it is cold and hot because of the air.
I agree.
I disagree because the water cycle never stops, even in cold places.
I disagree because evaporation happen when it is cold too.
I disagree with Angie because evaporation happens with cold water but it evaporates slower.
I disagree because evaporation happens in cool areas, just slower.
I disagree because evaporation can happen. When it is cold, too. Once, I left a cup of water out on a cold night, and the next morning it was gone.
I disagree, evaporation happens everywhere, even on cold days. It just takes longer when it is cool out.
I disagree because you can have a cold class of water sitting outside on a hot day and the water would evaporate.
I disagree because we tried evaporation with slightly cold water and it worked.
I disagree because when water is heated to a high temperature it does not evaporate quickly.
I disagree because it does evaporate in high temperatures but it just takes a little longer in cold air.
I disagree because the water only evaporation works on cold areas.
I disagree with Angie because evaporation can happen in the rain too.
I agree because when you take a warm shower it is all steamy and after that it evaporates on the glass.
I agree because it is true water does evaporate if you will put it on heated high.
I disagree because, evaporation has happened in my cold water before.
I disagree because if you put a cup of water and put it in a fridge it will still evaporate.
Agree.
I agree because water evaporates because it is too hot.
I agree because it says on our chart more water evaporates when heated.
I disagree because last year we put room temperature water in a cup and we put the cups outside when it was cold the water evaporated.
I disagree because in my class, evaporation can happen if cold too.
I agree. Because water evaporates it warms up. The water goes in the air and stays there until it hits something cool and solid.
I disagree because water can evaporate in the cold too, but when it is not it just evaporates faster.
If evaporation when it hot and cold mostly when it hot.
Because it can happen to anyone.
Because heat absorbs the water.
Because it has to evaporate into the clouds and when the clouds get too much water, it rains, and the word for that is condensation.
I agree with both because evaporation only happens when water is hot or cold.
I disagree because evaporation means it went up in the air or we all could die.
I disagree with Angie because it can still be cold.
I disagree because water does not only evaporate when it is at a high temperature it only evaporates quicker.
Agree because when condensation happens the water warms up and it evaporation happens.
I disagree because evaporation can happen when it is cold or hot outside it just evaporates faster when it is hot and slower in the cold.
I disagree because water can evaporate any time. Just when it is hot it evaporates quicker than when its cold.
Yes I agree because when water is hot it fogs up.
Water evaporation is also predicted by the volume mass.
I disagree because the surface area effects the evaporation. Also it just takes more time when the water is cold.
I disagree because it can also evaporate in air movement or when it is exposed to more air.
Disagree because there are more ways to make things evaporate, including, putting it by morning air.
I agree because anything with water on it in the heat will evaporate.
I disagree because if it rains the next day is gone.
I disagree because water can evaporate when it is breezy too!
I disagree because water can evaporate at any temperature.
I disagree. Water can evaporate at any temperature. Make the water make it evaporate faster.
I disagree because the water after it rains evaporates and it is not hot outside.
I disagree because evaporation is also involved with surface tension.
Agree because heat can help the time of evaporation.
I disagree because water does not always evaporate in hot water.
That is not true if you leave water out on a air conditioner for a month it will evaporate no heat needed.
I agree because if the temperature is higher the water will evaporate more.
I disagree. Because any water left out long enough will evaporate.
I disagree because it also depends on surface area and light. Something with light might evaporate more slowly than something with a lot of heat, but it will still evaporate.
I disagree. Evaporation can happen if the water is cold, it just takes longer.

Disagree. That is true, but there are better ways to say like, the water starts to steam at 212 and the molecules in the water start to jump around then and contract to the cold air because they are so hot that the molecules jump out and turn cold and get smaller and smaller.
I agree because the higher the temperature, the more evaporation. But evaporation does happen with cold water to.
Because on the floor it was not piled on top of each other. So there was more room to evaporate, so in the cup it was all confined so it had less room to evaporate.
I disagree because if you put a cup of water at a high elevation it is still going to evaporate.
I agree because hot air raises water molecules.
I disagree. The water in a hot area evaporates faster but cold water still evaporates just not as quickly.
I disagree because sometimes if you leave water spilled it would eventually evaporate.
Well it mostly happen when it is hot but it does not always, so I disagree!
I disagree that evaporation only happens when it is heated it happens all the time heated or not.
I agree because in our class we tried it and the cup outside did not evaporate that much because it was cold and the cup on the inside evaporated a lot and it was hot.
It happens at any temperature but it is faster at high temperatures.
Agree because it has to be hot.
No, because if you take a clear cap and fill it with water put a cap on it and put it in a sunny spot and let it sit for long that is a way to.
I disagree because evaporation happens if there is any temperature water, but it will evaporate faster with warm air.
I agree because water only evaporates when heat is near by.
I agree because steam is hot water flying around and taking the water out the cup.
I disagree because evaporation happens when water is cold.
I disagree because I heard evaporation is always happening and water is not always hot.
Yes I do agree because the sun shows how hot it can be with evaporation.
That is not true because the oceans can be cold but they still evaporate. Evaporation happens every second of every minute of everyday of every year!
Agree the sun is hot and the ground water evaporated.
I agree because water vapor is what gets evaporated. Water vapor is often times heat. If water is extremely cold it freezes.
I disagree because water can evaporate higher than 32 degrees Fahrenheit.
I disagree when water spills or is in a cup it evaporates.
I disagree if I spill water on my clothes it was probably cold water and it evaporates.
I disagree because hot water evaporates faster than cold but they both do evaporate.
I agree because you need hot air to evaporate something.
I disagree because any temperature water can evaporate.
That's not true because my group put ours in the freezer and it evaporated a little bit.
I disagree because it can happen on any kinds of water.
I disagree because when water is cold water is froze it gets smaller and evaporation.
Yes because water is cold then heat hits it then it turns to water vapor. Then goes up to the air.
